rules.natural: Either the manual is delayed or it is not the case that the manual is released.
Under the condition that the launch fails, then the launch is successful.
The project is over budget or the project is understaffed.
If the project is understaffed, the project is not profitable.
Provided that the developer develops the app, then either the company uses the device or, if the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.
The developer develops the app or the developer writes the manual.
If the developer writes the manual, then the company publishes the manual.

Provided that the manager approves the manual, then if the company publishes the manual, either the company uses the device or, on the condition that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.
Either the manager approves the manual or the manager rejects the manual.

Under the condition that the manager rejects the manual, then if the company publishes the manual, either the company uses the device or, given that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.
If the device is functional, then the project is funded.
Whenever it is not the case that either the manual is reviewed or, in case the project is over budget, then the project is not profitable, the manual is error-free.
If it is not the case that either the manual is reviewed or, provided that the project is over budget, then the project is not profitable, then the manual is not error-free.
Under the condition that it is not the case that either the company uses the device or, in the event that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer, then the launch fails.

Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the bug is critical or, assuming the device is not functional, then the device is faulty, then the bug is minor, it follows that the manual is released.

In case it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the bug is critical or, given that the device is not functional, then the device is faulty, then the bug is minor, then the project is profitable.
Under the condition that the project is not funded, the company does not hire the developer.

(A10 ∨ (¬A8 → A9)).natural: Either the bug is critical, or, provided that the device is not functional, it follows that the device is faulty.

(A13 ∨ ¬A12).natural: Either the manual is delayed or it is not the case that the manual is released.

(A15 → A14).natural: Under the condition that the launch fails, then the launch is successful.

(A17 → ¬A16).natural: Whenever the project is over budget, the project is not profitable.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: The project is over budget or the project is understaffed.

(A18 → ¬A16).natural: If the project is understaffed, the project is not profitable.

(A19 ∨ (A17 → ¬A16)).natural: Either the manual is reviewed, or, in case the project is over budget, it follows that the project is not profitable.

(A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)).natural: Either the company uses the device, or, given that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.

(A3 → (A2 ∨ (¬G → A1))).natural: Provided that the developer develops the app, then either the company uses the device or, if the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: The developer develops the app or the developer writes the manual.

(A4 → (A2 ∨ (¬G → A1))).natural: Whenever the developer writes the manual, it follows that either the company uses the device or, in the event that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.

(A4 → A5).natural: If the developer writes the manual, then the company publishes the manual.

(A5 → (A2 ∨ (¬G → A1))).natural: In case the company publishes the manual, then either the company uses the device or, assuming the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.

(A6 → (A5 → (A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)))).natural: Provided that the manager approves the manual, then if the company publishes the manual, either the company uses the device or, on the condition that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: Either the manager approves the manual or the manager rejects the manual.

(A7 → (A5 → (A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)))).natural: Under the condition that the manager rejects the manual, then if the company publishes the manual, either the company uses the device or, given that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.

(A8 → G).natural: If the device is functional, then the project is funded.

(¬(A10 ∨ (¬A8 → A9)) → A11).natural: Provided that it is not the case that either the bug is critical or, if the device is not functional, then the device is faulty, it follows that the bug is minor.

(¬(A19 ∨ (A17 → ¬A16)) → A20).natural: Whenever it is not the case that either the manual is reviewed or, in case the project is over budget, then the project is not profitable, the manual is error-free.

(¬(A19 ∨ (A17 → ¬A16)) → ¬A20).natural: If it is not the case that either the manual is reviewed or, provided that the project is over budget, then the project is not profitable, then the manual is not error-free.

(¬(A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)) → A14).natural: Given that it is not the case that either the company uses the device or, if the project is not funded, the company hires the developer, then the launch is successful.

(¬(A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)) → A15).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the company uses the device or, in the event that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer, then the launch fails.

(¬(¬(A10 ∨ (¬A8 → A9)) → A11) → A12).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the bug is critical or, assuming the device is not functional, then the device is faulty, then the bug is minor, it follows that the manual is released.

(¬(¬(A10 ∨ (¬A8 → A9)) → A11) → A16).natural: In case it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the bug is critical or, given that the device is not functional, then the device is faulty, then the bug is minor, then the project is profitable.

(¬A8 → A9).natural: If the device is not functional, then the device is faulty.

(¬G → A1).natural: Provided that the project is not funded, the company hires the developer.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: Under the condition that the project is not funded, the company does not hire the developer.

¬A10.natural: It is not the case that the bug is critical.

¬A11.natural: It is not the case that the bug is minor.

¬A2.natural: The company does not use the device.
